mnd4:1.1: <em>23 : I see purity: the highest, disease-free,
mnd4:1.2: A human being completely purified by seeing,
mnd4:1.3: When he knows that "this is the highest," when he knows this way,
mnd4:1.4: "He is the pure one who observes," he returns to wisdom.
mnd4:1.5: <em>23 : I see purity: the highest, disease-free,
mnd4:1.6: A human being completely purified by seeing,
mnd4:1.7: When he knows that "this is the highest," when he knows this way,
mnd4:1.8: "He is the pure one who observes," he returns to wisdom.
mnd4:1.9: <em>23 : I see purity: the highest, disease-free,
mnd4:1.10: A human being completely purified by seeing,
mnd4:1.11: When he knows that "this is the highest," when he knows this way,
mnd4:1.12: "He is the pure one who observes," he returns to wisdom.
mnd4:1.13: <em>23 : I see purity: the highest, disease-free,
mnd4:1.14: A human being completely purified by seeing,
mnd4:1.15: When he knows that "this is the highest," when he knows this way,
mnd4:1.16: "He is the pure one who observes," he returns to wisdom.
mnd4:2.1: "I see purity: the highest, disease-free": "I see purity," I see purity, I look
mnd4:2.2: at purity, I watch purity, I observe purity. "The highest, disease-free," the
mnd4:2.3: highest, the disease-free, the one who reaches the sanctuary, the one who
mnd4:2.4: reaches the refuge, the one who reaches the shelter, the one who reaches no
mnd4:2.5: fear, the one who reaches the non-living, the one who reaches the extinction,
mnd4:3.1: "Complete purity by seeing": To see the form with the eyes is to see the purity,
mnd4:3.2: purification, and complete purity of a person; detachment, liberation, and
mnd4:3.3: disengagement, and a person becomes pure, purified, and completely pure; freed,
mnd4:4.1: "When he knows this way, he knows that 'it is the highest'": When this way is
mnd4:4.2: known, certain, and penetrated. "This is the highest, the first, the most
mnd4:4.3: superior, the victorious, the top, the highest." After he knows, understands,
mnd4:5.1: "'He is the one who observes in purity,' he returns to wisdom": Whoever sees
mnd4:5.2: purity, he is the one who observes purity. "He returns to wisdom." He who sees
mnd4:5.3: form with eye awareness returns to "wisdom;" returns to the Path, returns to the
mnd4:6.1: <em>24 : If someone is pure by seeing,
mnd4:6.2: Or if he gives up suffering through wisdom,
mnd4:6.3: Then there are those who rely on other (things) to be come pure;
mnd4:6.4: It should be said that he is indeed such a speaker.
mnd4:6.5: <em>24 : If someone is pure by seeing,
mnd4:6.6: Or if he gives up suffering through wisdom,
mnd4:6.7: Then there are those who rely on other (things) to be come pure;
mnd4:6.8: It should be said that he is indeed such a speaker.
mnd4:6.9: <em>24 : If someone is pure by seeing,
mnd4:6.10: Or if he gives up suffering through wisdom,
mnd4:6.11: Then there are those who rely on other (things) to be come pure;
mnd4:6.12: It should be said that he is indeed such a speaker.
mnd4:6.13: <em>24 : If someone is pure by seeing,
mnd4:6.14: Or if he gives up suffering through wisdom,
mnd4:6.15: Then there are those who rely on other (things) to be come pure;
mnd4:6.16: It should be said that he is indeed such a speaker.
mnd4:7.1: "If someone is pure by seeing": To see the form with our eyes... (omitted).
mnd4:8.1: "Or if he can give up suffering with wisdom": If he can see with his eyes, and
mnd4:8.2: if one gives up life and suffering, old age suffering, sickness, death, and
mnd4:9.1: "There are those who rely on others to become pure": With other things, impure
mnd4:9.2: ways, evil ways, and non-existence, in addition to (besides) mindfulness, in
mnd4:9.3: addition to all right work, in addition to the divine bases, in addition to the
mnd4:9.4: roots, in addition to the strengths, in addition to the enlightenment, in
mnd4:9.5: addition to the eight branches of the holy path, man becomes pure, becomes
mnd4:9.6: purified, becomes pure throughout; is freed, liberated, and departed from all
mnd4:9.7: over. The "reliant" are those who have greed, hatred, ignorance, sloth, thirst,
mnd4:10.1: "It should be said that he is indeed such a speaker": The one who sees (these
mnd4:10.2: views) and speaks: Like this, this person is (one with) a wrong view, a reverse
mnd4:10.3: view. "It is such a speaker," is such a speaker, narrator, sayer, explainer,
mnd4:10.4: speaker: "The world is constant, this is true, and everything else is empty."
mnd4:10.5: Such a speaker... "The world is very constant... The world is bounded... The
mnd4:10.6: world is boundless... Fate is the body... Fate is one body is the other...
mnd4:10.7: Tathāgata exists after death... Tathāgata does not exist after death... The
mnd4:10.8: Tathāgata after death exists and does not exist... The Tathāgata after death
mnd4:10.9: neither exists nor does not exist; this is true, and everything else is empty."
mnd4:10.10: Such a sayer, narrator, talker, interpreter, and speaker.
mnd4:11.1: <em>25 : Brāhmaṇas do not say purity comes from others (things or views),
mnd4:11.2: Or in what they see, hear, or precepts and prohibitions, or feel,
mnd4:11.3: Not being contaminated by merit and evil, abandoning what is taken (up),
mnd4:11.5: <em>25 : Brāhmaṇas do not say purity comes from others (things or views),
mnd4:11.6: Or in what they see, hear, or precepts and prohibitions, or feel,
mnd4:11.7: Not being contaminated by merit and evil, abandoning what is taken (up),
mnd4:11.9: <em>25 : Brāhmaṇas do not say purity comes from others (things or views),
mnd4:11.10: Or in what they see, hear, or precepts and prohibitions, or feel,
mnd4:11.11: Not being contaminated by merit and evil, abandoning what is taken (up),
mnd4:11.13: <em>25 : Brāhmaṇas do not say purity comes from others (things or views),
mnd4:11.14: Or in what they see, hear, or precepts and prohibitions, or feel,
mnd4:11.15: Not being contaminated by merit and evil, abandoning what is taken (up),
mnd4:12.1: "Brāhmaṇas are not pure from others, in what they see, hear, precepts and
mnd4:12.2: prohibitions or perceptions": "Not" means negation. "Brāhmaṇa," the exclusion of
mnd4:12.3: the seven dhammas is the Brāhmaṇa: seeing is excluded, doubt is excluded,
mnd4:12.4: abstinence is excluded, greed is excluded, aversion is excluded, illusion is
mnd4:12.5: eliminated, sloth is eliminated, those evil and unwholesome methods are
mnd4:12.6: eliminated: those that are contaminated, those that are no longer there, those
mnd4:12.7: that are fearful, those who will suffer the consequences, and those who will die
mnd4:13.7: Like this can be called Brāhmaṇa."
mnd4:14.1: "Brāhmaṇas do not say purity is from others," With other things ..., the
mnd4:14.2: Brāhmaṇa does not speak, say, talk, or explain, does not say.
mnd4:15.1: "In what they see, hear, precepts and prohibition, or perceptions." Some Samaṇas
mnd4:15.2: and Brāhmaṇas regard seeing as pure. They identify seeing certain forms as
mnd4:15.3: auspicious, and believe that seeing certain forms as unlucky. What type of sight
mnd4:15.4: do they believe is auspicious? In the early morning they saw the auspicious
mnd4:15.5: forms: seeing sparrows, seeing the gorgeous and colorful Marmelos trees,
mnd4:15.6: ...pregnant women, ...boy on the shoulders of a man, full urns, Samaṇas, horses,
mnd4:15.7: horse carts, bulls, oxen; they believe that seeing things like that is
mnd4:15.8: auspicious. What types of sights do they believe are unlucky? Seeing the straw
mnd4:15.9: pile, ...the butter urn, the empty urn, the dancers, the nude fake Samaṇas, the
mnd4:15.10: mule, the donkey carriage ride, the single-harness ride, the one-eyed person,
mnd4:15.11: hand deformity, the lame person, the half-body, the elderly, and the sick; they
mnd4:15.12: believe that it is unlucky to see things like that. These are those Samaṇas and
mnd4:15.13: Brāhmaṇas who see what they see as pure.
mnd4:16.1: Some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas regard what they hear is pure. They believe that
mnd4:16.2: hearing certain sounds is auspicious, and they believe that hearing certain
mnd4:16.3: sounds is unlucky. Which sounds do they believe are auspicious? In the early
mnd4:16.4: morning they heard an auspicious voice: "Prosperity," or "precious," or "full,"
mnd4:16.5: or "gorgeous," or "worry-free," or "good will," or "good star," or "good luck,"
mnd4:16.6: or "lucky," or "luck increase;" they believe that hearing sounds like this is
mnd4:16.7: auspicious. Which sounds do they believe are unlucky? "One-eye," or "hand
mnd4:16.8: deformity," or "lame," or "half-body," or "elderly," or "patient (sick)," or
mnd4:16.9: "dead," or "cut," or "broken," or "burned," or "disappeared," or "none;" they
mnd4:16.10: believe that hearing sounds like this is unlucky.
mnd4:17.1: Some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas regard precepts as purity. They believe that the
mnd4:17.2: degree of precept, the degree of (self) restraint, the degree of self-control,
mnd4:17.3: and the degree of non-violation are pure, clean.... Uggāhamāna Samaṇamuṇḍika
mnd4:17.4: said: Homeowner! I have established that the men who possess the four methods
mnd4:17.5: are those who have goodness, the highest of goodness, those who obtain the
mnd4:17.6: supreme attainment, and the Samaṇa (does not exist) who cannot overcome them.
mnd4:17.7: Which four? Homeowner! Here, he does not act evil deeds, does not speak evil
mnd4:17.8: words, does not intend with evil intentions, does not live a life of evil,
mnd4:17.9: owner! I have established that the man who possesses these four methods is the
mnd4:17.10: one who has goodness, the supreme one who is good, the one who is supremely
mnd4:17.11: attained, and the unsurpassable Samaṇa [MN.78]. Similarly, some Samaṇas and
mnd4:18.1: Some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas regard the prohibition as pure. They are those who
mnd4:18.2: guard (prohibit) the elephant, or the horse, or the cow, or the dog, or the
mnd4:18.3: crow, or Vishnu, or the power of gods, or the sage, or the pearl sage, or the
mnd4:18.4: fire, or the dragon, or the golden-winged bird, or the Yakkha, or the asura, or
mnd4:18.5: the Gandhabba, or the great king, or the moon, or the sun, or the Indā, or the
mnd4:18.6: Brahma, or devas, or the position.
mnd4:19.1: Some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas consider what they feel is pure. They touch the
mnd4:19.2: earth, in the early morning, touch grass, cow dung, turtle, hoe, sesame carrier,
mnd4:19.3: chew auspicious sesame seeds, chew auspicious oil, chew auspicious tooth wood,
mnd4:19.4: bathe with auspicious soil, wear auspicious clothes, and wrap a lucky headscarf.
mnd4:20.1: "In what you see, hear, precepts and prohibitions, or perception," a Brāhmaṇa
mnd4:20.2: does not say purity is in what he sees; he does not say purity is in what he
mnd4:20.3: hears; he is not pure by precepts; he is not pure by prohibitions; and he is not
mnd4:20.4: (pure) by what he feels. Purity means purity; to not tell, not talk, not
mnd4:21.1: "Not to be polluted in virtue and evil": Virtue is called all the good works of
mnd4:21.2: the three realms, and non-benefit (evil) is called all unwholesome (works).
mnd4:21.3: Because the good deeds and non-blessings and immovable deeds are cut off, the
mnd4:21.4: root has been cut off just like a palm tree without roots, it becomes non-being,
mnd4:21.5: something that will not grow for the future; in this case, it is not
mnd4:21.6: contaminated, not strongly contaminated, not closely contaminated in virtue and
mnd4:21.7: evil, no longer contaminated, no longer strongly contaminated, no longer
mnd4:21.8: contaminated closely. He has left, has departed, has been freed, has been freed
mnd4:21.9: from bondage, he dwells with an unrestrained heart.
mnd4:22.1: "Abandon what you take, and don't make (anything) here": "Abandon what you take"
mnd4:22.2: means forsaking your vision; "abandon what you take" means forsaking
mnd4:22.3: perseverance; "abandon what you take" means holding on because of craving for
mnd4:22.4: love and seeing; all that is held, clinging, taking, and faithful to are
mnd4:22.5: abandoned, spit out, released, dismissed, and discontinued by him. "Those who do
mnd4:22.6: not make (anything) here," the one that is not making merit, the one that is not
mnd4:22.7: made to be born, the one that is not to be produced, the one that is not making
mnd4:23.1: <em>26 : After cutting off the previous one and becoming the subsequent follower,
mnd4:23.2: The disturbed followers to not cross the tie,
mnd4:23.3: They pick up (views, masters, etc.) and let go,
mnd4:23.4: Like a monkey grabbing a branch and letting go.
mnd4:23.5: <em>26 : After cutting off the previous one and becoming the subsequent follower,
mnd4:23.6: The disturbed followers to not cross the tie,
mnd4:23.7: They pick up (views, masters, etc.) and let go,
mnd4:23.8: Like a monkey grabbing a branch and letting go.
mnd4:23.9: <em>26 : After cutting off the previous one and becoming the subsequent follower,
mnd4:23.10: The disturbed followers to not cross the tie,
mnd4:23.11: They pick up (views, masters, etc.) and let go,
mnd4:23.12: Like a monkey grabbing a branch and letting go.
mnd4:23.13: <em>26 : After cutting off the previous one and becoming the subsequent follower,
mnd4:23.14: The disturbed followers to not cross the tie,
mnd4:23.15: They pick up (views, masters, etc.) and let go,
mnd4:23.16: Like a monkey grabbing a branch and letting go.
mnd4:24.1: "Rejecting the former and becoming the subsequent followers": After the former
mnd4:24.2: master, becoming the follower (adherent) of other masters; ...narratives of
mnd4:24.4: Those who are completely dependent, adherents (followers), entrants, those who
mnd4:24.5: are tied, and those who turn their minds towards (these things).
mnd4:25.1: "Followers who are disturbed do not get through the tie": Disturbance is called
mnd4:25.2: craving, which is greed.... "Disturbed followers," the disturbed follower, the
mnd4:25.3: perturbed follower, the one who is taken down by the disturbance, the
mnd4:25.4: overthrown, the conquered, the one whose heart is overtaken. "They don't get
mnd4:25.5: through the tie," the greed tie, the hatred tie, the sloth tie, the polluted
mnd4:25.6: tie, the evil doings tie, they don't get over, don't transcend, don't pass,
mnd4:26.1: "They pick up and let go": They grab a master, let go of that one and then grab
mnd4:26.2: other masters; ...the narration of the dhamma...; the crowd, the view, the
mnd4:26.3: path..., they grab and let go, take and let go.
mnd4:27.1: "Like a monkey grabbing a branch and letting it go": Like a monkey roaming in
mnd4:27.2: the woods and forests grabbing a branch, letting go of that branch and then
mnd4:27.3: grabbing another branch [SN.12.61]; the same, most of the Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas
mnd4:27.4: catch and let go, take and let go of the evil opinions of the majority.
mnd4:28.1: <em>27 : After a person is restrained by himself,
mnd4:28.2: He wants to adhere to him high and low,
mnd4:28.3: After the wise man takes the Dhamma,
mnd4:28.4: The wise man does not go high and low.
mnd4:28.5: <em>27 : After a person is restrained by himself,
mnd4:28.6: He wants to adhere to him high and low,
mnd4:28.7: After the wise man takes the Dhamma,
mnd4:28.8: The wise man does not go high and low.
mnd4:28.9: <em>27 : After a person is restrained by himself,
mnd4:28.10: He wants to adhere to him high and low,
mnd4:28.11: After the wise man takes the Dhamma,
mnd4:28.12: The wise man does not go high and low.
mnd4:28.13: <em>27 : After a person is restrained by himself,
mnd4:28.14: He wants to adhere to him high and low,
mnd4:28.15: After the wise man takes the Dhamma,
mnd4:28.16: The wise man does not go high and low.
mnd4:29.1: "After a person is restrained by himself": "Holding oneself" means holding by
mnd4:29.2: oneself (self-sustaining). "Prohibition," ...; after he takes it, after holding,
mnd4:29.3: after assuming, after grasping, after attachment. "Man," Sentient beings, human
mnd4:29.4: beings, student Brāhmaṇas, people, individuals, lives, those born to people,
mnd4:29.5: those born to Indā, and Manu.
mnd4:30.1: "Adhering to him and walking high and low": He walked from master to master;
mnd4:30.2: from Dhamma to Dhamma; .... "I want to be stuck," want to think, think
mnd4:30.3: maliciously, think about harm, think about sticking, entangled, bound, attached,
mnd4:30.4: fixed, obstacles, such as objects on a wall pile or a wall nail, the upper part
mnd4:30.5: is stuck, entangled, bound, attached, fixed, obstructed. In the same way, wanted
mnd4:30.6: to be thought, malicious thought, persecuted, seen to be stuck, entangled,
mnd4:31.1: "After the wise man takes the Dhamma (lit. the Vedas Dhamma)": The "wise man" is
mnd4:31.2: the wise man, the enlightened man, the distinguished man, and the wise man who
mnd4:31.3: has given up his craving for adhesion. After breaking the adhesion of the mind,
mnd4:31.4: one will not be contaminated in what you see; not contaminated in what you
mnd4:31.5: smell; not contaminated in what you feel; not contaminated, not strongly
mnd4:31.6: contaminated, not closely contaminated, no longer contaminated, no longer
mnd4:31.7: strongly contaminated, no longer contaminated closely. He has left, has
mnd4:31.8: departed, has been liberated, has been freed from bondage, he dwells with an
mnd4:32.1: "In the Vedas," the Vedas are called wisdom, root of wisdom, power of wisdom,
mnd4:32.2: enlightenment, investigation, vipassanā, right view in the four realms. For
mnd4:32.3: those who have reached the ultimate (target) in the Vedas, those who have
mnd4:32.4: reached the ultimate, have reached the end; those who have reached the end, have
mnd4:32.5: reached the boundary (ultimate); those who have reached the boundary, have
mnd4:32.6: reached the end; those who have reached the end, have arrived at the shelter;
mnd4:32.7: those who have reached the shelter, have reached the refuge; those who have
mnd4:32.8: reached the refuge, have reached safety; those who have reached safety, have
mnd4:32.9: reached no terror; those who have reached no terror, have reached no death;
mnd4:32.10: those who have reached no death, have reached the undeath; those who have
mnd4:32.11: reached the undeath, have reached extinction; those who have reached extinction,
mnd4:32.12: have reached the Nibbāna. Or "the one who has reached the Vedas" is the one who
mnd4:32.13: knows the Vedas, or the known state of the seven dhammas is the one who knows
mnd4:32.14: the Vedas: seeing is knowns suspicion is known, abstinence is known, greed is
mnd4:32.15: known, hatred is known, ignorance is known, conceit is known, and its evil and
mnd4:32.16: unwholesome methods are known: contaminated, again, fearful, suffering, the
mnd4:33.3: All those belonging to the Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇas that exist here,
mnd4:33.4: He is free from greed in all feelings,
mnd4:33.5: And after surpassing all Vedas, he is one who knows the Vedas well."
mnd4:34.1: "After the wise man took the Dhamma": Union, after seeing the Dhamma: "All
mnd4:34.2: actions are impermanent" as the union, after seeing the Dhamma, "all actions are
mnd4:34.3: suffering" ..., "all dhammas are non-self" ..., "formation is dependent on
mnd4:34.4: ignorance" ..., "consciousness is based on formation" ..., name and form..., six
mnd4:34.6: (becoming...,), birth..., old age and death...; extinguishment by the death of
mnd4:34.7: ignorance, undertaking to perish and be extinguished, extinguishing by knowing
mnd4:34.8: and by name, extinguishing by name and appearance and in six sense bases,
mnd4:34.9: extinguishing by touch in six sense bases, the extinction of touch, ...the
mnd4:34.10: extinction of thirst..., ...by thirst and love..., ...to be born and to die
mnd4:34.11: out...; ..."this is suffering"..., this is the collection of suffering, this is
mnd4:34.12: the cessation of suffering, this is the path leading to (the cessation of)
mnd4:34.13: suffering; these are the defilements, this is the collection of defilements,
mnd4:34.14: this is the cessation of defilement, this is the path leading to the cessation
mnd4:34.15: defilements; these dhammas should be proven, these dhammas should be known,
mnd4:34.16: these dhammas should be widely known, these dhammas should be cut off, these
mnd4:34.17: dhammas should be practiced, these dhammas should be testified to; gathering,
mnd4:34.18: extinction, pleasure, affliction, and renunciation of the six touch points...,
mnd4:34.19: gathering, ..., of the five aggregates..., ...of the four major species; "any
mnd4:34.20: collection of dhammas is extinguishing of the dhammas"..., as the union, after
mnd4:35.1: "The wise man does not go high and low": He does not go from master to master,
mnd4:35.2: does not go from the narration of the Dhamma to the narration of the Dhamma,
mnd4:35.3: ...(omitted) "The wise one," the wise one is the great wise one, the quick wise
mnd4:35.4: one, the wiser, the insightful one; as the earth is called wide, he has the same
mnd4:35.5: vast and expanding wisdom as the earth.
mnd4:36.1: <em>28 : He is a person who has left the legion in all dhammas:
mnd4:36.3: Who can classify (him) in this world,
mnd4:36.4: Who has seen and opened up like this?
mnd4:36.5: <em>28 : He is a person who has left the legion in all dhammas:
mnd4:36.7: Who can classify (him) in this world,
mnd4:36.8: Who has seen and opened up like this?
mnd4:36.9: <em>28 : He is a person who has left the legion in all dhammas:
mnd4:36.11: Who can classify (him) in this world,
mnd4:36.12: Who has seen and opened up like this?
mnd4:36.13: <em>28 : He is a person who has left the legion in all dhammas:
mnd4:36.15: Who can classify (him) in this world,
mnd4:36.16: Who has seen and opened up like this?
mnd4:37.1: "He is the one who has left the legion in all dhammas: whatever he sees or hears
mnd4:37.2: and perceives": The legion is called the demon army, the bodily evil act is the
mnd4:37.3: devil army; the evil act of speech is the devil army; the evil act of intention
mnd4:37.4: is the devil army; hatred is...; ignorance is...; anger is...; ...(omitted); all
mnd4:37.5: bad works are the devil army.
mnd4:38.1: This was said by the Blessed One: [Sn.3.2]
mnd4:38.4: Hunger and thirst are your third,
mnd4:38.7: Fear is said to be sixth,
mnd4:38.10: He who has a respectful reputation,
mnd4:38.11: And the reputation gained by mistakes (wrongfully),
mnd4:38.12: Who would praise oneself and contempt others.
mnd4:38.15: Those who have no courage will not defeat him,
mnd4:38.16: And they will get peace after victory."
mnd4:39.1: When all the demon army and all the hostile pollution are conquered, defeated,
mnd4:39.2: destroyed, disintegrated, and turned away by the Four Holy Paths, he is called
mnd4:39.3: the one who leaves the legion. He is the one who leaves the legion in what he
mnd4:39.4: sees; the one who leaves the legion in what he hears; the one who leaves the
mnd4:39.5: legion in the sense; the one who leaves the legion in the knowledge.
mnd4:40.1: "The one who sees this way, the one who has opened up": The one who sees this
mnd4:40.2: purity, the one who sees purely, the one whose vision is pure; the one who sees
mnd4:40.3: clearly, the one who sees all-purely, or the pure seer, seeing purely, seeing
mnd4:40.4: cleanly, seeing clearly and purely. "Opened," there are coverings of craving,
mnd4:40.5: covering of seeing, covering of pollution, covering of evil deeds, covering of
mnd4:40.6: ignorance; those coverings have been opened, have been destroyed, have been
mnd4:40.7: unlocked, have been completely unlocked, have been cut off, have been severed,
mnd4:40.8: have been calmed down, have ceased, cannot arise, have been burned by the fire
mnd4:40.9: of wisdom. "Walker," the walker, the dweller, the actor, the on-goer, the
mnd4:41.1: "Who can classify (him) in this world": "Classification," there are two
mnd4:41.2: classifications: the classification of craving and the classification of
mnd4:41.3: seeing.... For him, the classification of craving has been cut off, the
mnd4:41.4: classification of seeing has been cut off.... According to what type of greed
mnd4:41.5: can be classified, what type of anger can be classified, ...? The state in which
mnd4:41.6: the deeds have been cut off...? He has no cause, no fate.... "In the world," in

mnd4:43.1: "They do not construct and pay no attention": "Construction," there are two
mnd4:43.2: types of constructions: .... For them, the construction of thirst has been cut
mnd4:43.3: off, .... They do not construct, do not make, to not make it to arise, do not
mnd4:43.4: make the construction of craving or the construction of view. They do not
mnd4:43.5: construct. "No attention (no preference)," There are two types of attention:
mnd4:43.6: .... For them, the attention of thirst has been cut off....
mnd4:44.1: "They don't say 'It's really pure'": It's really pure, pure reincarnation, the
mnd4:44.2: view of non-action, constant theory, they don't say, don't tell, don't talk,
mnd4:45.1: "After leaving the bondage of clinging": "Binding," there are four types of
mnd4:45.2: binding: the greedy body binding, the malicious body binding, the forbidden body
mnd4:45.3: binding, '(only) this is true' binding [SN.45.175]. The greed of one's own view
mnd4:45.4: is the bond of greed, the anger and dissatisfaction of others are the bond of
mnd4:45.5: malicious body; "holding one's own precepts or prohibitions" is the body binding
mnd4:45.6: of precepts and prohibitions, and one's own view (holding body binding
mnd4:45.7: [Ni.13,147]) is '(only) this is the real binding' body binding. For what reason
mnd4:45.8: is it called grasping bindings? With those bindings, they seize, cling, hold,
mnd4:45.9: grasp, take, and receive..., thinking..., doing..., knowing..., incarnation...,
mnd4:45.10: death..., existence..., reincarnation..., in the cycle they grasp, cling, hold,
mnd4:45.11: take, and cling to, for this reason they are called clinging binding. "After
mnd4:45.12: leaving," after giving up on the binding, after giving up, either on the
mnd4:45.13: binding, on the bondage, on the expansion of the binding, on the entangled, on
mnd4:45.14: the attached, on the fixed, on the obstacles, after shaking off the binding,
mnd4:45.15: after being left behind; such as with a sedan chair, or carriage, wagon truck,
mnd4:45.16: or chariot that transports (people), after they are released (get off), the
mnd4:45.17: clinging to that place is destroyed, in the same way, after giving up on the
mnd4:45.18: binding, it is after leaving, or on the bondage..., after having shaken off the
mnd4:46.1: "They don't make wishes (have desires) no matter where they are in the world":
mnd4:46.2: Wishes are called cravings, which are greed.... "Don't make wishes," the wish,
mnd4:46.3: they do not do, do not produce, do not arise, to not make it to be produced.
mnd4:47.1: "No matter where," no matter where, wherever, inside or outside or (both) inside
mnd4:47.2: and outside. "In the world," in the world of suffering, the world of humans, the
mnd4:47.3: world of heaven, the world of aggregates, the world of realms, the world of
mnd4:48.1: <em>30 : The Brāhmaṇa who has crossed the boundary,
mnd4:48.3: There are people who are not greedy,
mnd4:48.4: And people who are not free from greed.
mnd4:48.5: For him, there is nothing grasped as the highest here.

mnd4:49.1: "The Brāhmaṇa who has crossed the boundary, not holding tightly after knowing
mnd4:49.2: and seeing": "Boundary," there are four boundaries: heretical views, doubting,
mnd4:49.3: handling ceremonial observances, and the latent troubles, as well as the
mnd4:49.4: pollution that coexists with (them), this is the first type of boundary; the
mnd4:49.5: thick desire knot, the disgust knot, the thick potential trend of desire and
mnd4:49.6: greed, the potential trend of disgust and trouble, and the pollution that
mnd4:49.7: coexists with (them), this is the second boundary; the remaining desire and
mnd4:49.8: greed knots, disgust knots, the remaining potential trends of desire and greed
mnd4:49.9: troubles, the potential trends of disgust troubles, and the pollution that
mnd4:49.10: coexists with (them), this is the third boundary; lust, formless greed, conceit,
mnd4:49.11: aversion, ignorance, the latent trend of conceit troubles, the latent trend of
mnd4:49.12: greed troubles, the latent trend of ignorant troubles, and the pollution that
mnd4:49.13: coexists with (them) is the fourth boundary. When these four boundaries are
mnd4:49.14: crossed, surpassed, and overcome by the Four Holy Paths, they are said to have
mnd4:49.15: crossed the boundaries. "Brāhmaṇa," .... "For him," for the Arahant, for the one
mnd4:50.1: "After knowing," after knowing it in his mind, or knowing it with the wisdom of
mnd4:50.2: reminiscences of previous lives. "After seeing," after seeing with naked eyes,
mnd4:50.3: or seeing with heavenly eyes. "The Brāhmaṇa who has crossed the boundary does
mnd4:50.4: not hold tightly after he knew it and saw it": For him, "This is the highest,
mnd4:50.5: the first, the most victorious, the winning, the top," being held, clung to,
mnd4:50.6: attached, taken, believed, he does not, does not exist, is not known, is not
mnd4:50.7: discovered, has been cut off, severed, calmed down, ceased, unable to arise,
mnd4:50.8: burned by the fire of wisdom.
mnd4:51.1: "There are people who are not greedy, and people who are not free from greed":
mnd4:51.2: The people who are greedy are called all the five types of desires who are
mnd4:51.3: greedy, tied, bound, obsessed, tainted, attached, fixed, obstructed. The person
mnd4:51.4: who is free from greed is called the supreme greed, greed, lust, bound,
mnd4:51.5: obsessed, tainted, attached, fixed, and obstructed in the realm of materiality
mnd4:51.6: and non-materiality. "There are those who are not greedy, and those who are not
mnd4:51.7: free from greed." Because desire, greed, formed greed and formless greed have
mnd4:51.8: been cut off, the roots have been cut off, like a palm tree without roots,
mnd4:51.9: becoming a non-living thing for the future, in this case, there are those who
mnd4:51.10: are greedy, and those who are not greedy.
mnd4:52.1: "For him there is nothing held as the highest here": "For him," for the Arahant,
mnd4:52.2: for the one who has exhausted troubles. For him, "This is the highest and first,
mnd4:52.3: ...," does not, does not exist, is not known, ..., and burned by the fire of
